title: 10cm hail causes widespread destruction in southeast Queensland | ABC NEWS
description: Tens of thousands of homes are without power after severe thunderstorms whipped south-eastern Queensland with giant hail and gale force winds.  Heavy rain and strong winds battered the Gold Coast, Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast, knocking down powerlines and uprooting trees. title: Trump flags progress in Ukraine peace talks | ABC NEWS
description: Ukrainian and US leaders have spruiked â€˜significant progressâ€™ in Ukraine peace talks, with US President Donald trump hinting at a breakthrough in negotiations.  The 28-point proposal has been revised, reserving contentious issues for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian leader Vladimir Putin.  Moscow is believed to dislike the amended proposal, labelling it a European counterproposal.  The main sticking points in the way of a ceasefire are the Kremlinâ€™s demand for Ukraine to cede territory and reduce its militaryâ€™s size.  The Coalition of the Willing are set to discuss the peace plan.  Meanwhile, Russian air strikes have killed at least four and injured 13 others including children in Kharkiv. title: Housing affordability in Australia has never been worse: Cotality report | ABC NEWS
description: A new report by Cotality has found it now takes eleven years to save a standard 20 per cent deposit for house in most capital cities. The study has found a median property value is now over eight times higher than the median salary. title: Pauline Hanson cooks steaks for Barnaby Joyce on a sandwich press | ABC NEWS
description: In supplied vision, One Nation leader Pauline Hanson is seen cooking a steak on a sandwich press at a dinner she hosted for Barnaby Joyce in Canberra. Senator Hanson has been trying to lure Joyce to One Nation after he stepped away from the Nationals over net zero. Nationals MP Michael McCormack says the former deputy prime minister needs to make up his mind soon about whether he wants to switch parties. title: Defiant Hezbollah supporters mourn slain leader | ABC NEWS
description: Thousands of Hezbollah supporters have lined the streets of Beirut to mourn Haytham Ali Tabatabai who was killed in an Israeli air strike. Tabatabai was effectively Hezbollah's second in command. Lebanon has accused Israel of continuing violations of its sovereignty, while Israel says it will continue to strike at perceived threats. title: BHP's mining operations in SA outback use 33m litres of water a day | ABC NEWS
description: Arabana elders from the north of South Australia are calling on mining giant BHP to cease water extraction from the Great Artesian Basin, where many culturally significant local mound springs have been damaged or have dried up, affecting local ecosystems.  BHP currently extracts more than 33 million litres of water per day from the basin for its Olympic Dam operations, but says it acknowledges the cultural significance of the mound springs and the Great Artesian Basin to the Arabana people, and that it regularly engages with traditional owners.  The SA government is proposing to build a major desalination plant in the Upper Spencer Gulf, which would provide water to BHP and other industries. Environmentalists are calling for water extraction to end once the desalination plant is operational.   Original reporting by Leah MacLennan for ABC News SA. Social version by Madeleine Wales.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: 15yo boy charged with murder after teen dies in Sydney stabbing | ABC NEWS
description: A 17-year-old boy has been fatally stabbed in the leg with a knife in Sydney's north-west. A 15-year-old boy has been charged with murder after presenting to a police station and is assisting with the investigation. Police said they were still looking for as many as two other people allegedly involved in the incident.  Video by Max Tillman.
